intro: Lastrea bipinnata, commonly known as the sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are opposite and often have a pinnate structure, giving it the species name "bipinnata." The flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in summer and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
